page.title: 06TYPICAL VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: Village life, as anywhere is very different to town life. Dalmally is a typical Scottish village in this sense. Villages exsistence and wellbeing depends initially on employment. In this village the main sources of employment are, forestry -both Forestry Commision and Economic Forestry,British Rail to maintain and run the Oban-Glasgow line,Hydro Electirc power station at Cruachan,service industry,tourist industry and farming. Most secondary and tertiary services are provided for us from our nearest large town,Oban. Unemployment at this time is a problem nationally at the moment,Dalmally suffers in that many young people move away from the area to find work therefore the population is lessening.
